articles.title: Yahoo Finance's market update: Dec. 6, 2018 - Yahoo Finance
articles.content: Stocks sold off after the arrest of a Chinese telecommunications company executive muddled prospects of a U.S.-China trade resolution. The S&P 500 ( ^GSPC ) fell 1.5%, or 40.48 points, as of 12:32 p.m. ET. The Dow ( ^DJI ) slid 1.92%, or 480.13 points, af… [+7641 chars]
articles.description: Stocks sold off after the arrest of a Chinese telecommunications company executive muddled prospects of a U.S.-China trade resolution.

articles.title: Claiming a tax deduction for medical expenses is getting harder. What to do before the end of the year - CNBC
articles.content: For instance, you could consider getting medical procedures or equipment and supplies (i.e., new glasses or a new wheelchair) before the end of the year instead of putting them off. If you do it with hopes of deducting your associated costs on your 2018 retur… [+576 chars]

articles.description: Before the calendar flips to 2019 and the threshold for the deduction rises, you might be able to take these steps and still qualify for the write-off.

articles.title: Amazon workers taken to hospital after machine punctures can of bear repellent in warehouse - Boston.com
articles.content: ROBBINSVILLE, N.J. (AP) An automated machine punctured a can of bear repellent at an Amazon warehouse in New Jersey on Wednesday, releasing fumes that sickened workers and sent two dozen to hospitals, officials said. An Amazon representative said that as of 8… [+1269 chars]

articles.description: The incident, which occurred at a New Jersey warehouse on Wednesday, sickened workers and sent two dozen to hospitals.

articles.title: This CEO thinks it's crazy to work more than 40 hours a week - CNN
articles.author: Jeanne Sahadi, CNN Business
articles.description: Jason Fried, cofounder of Basecamp, a Web-based management tool to organize projects and teams, doesn't believe in working more than 40 hours a week.

articles.title: Freddie Mac: Mortgage rates finally fall | 2018-12-06 - HousingWire
articles.content: After weeks of moderation, mortgage rates have finally fallen, according to the latest Freddie Mac Primary Mortgage Market Survey. According to the survey, the 30-year fixed-rate mortgage fell from 4.81% last week, averaging 4.75% for the week ending Dec. 6, … [+710 chars]
articles.description: After weeks of moderation, mortgage rates have finally fallen, according to the latest Freddie Mac Primary Mortgage Market Survey. Freddie Mac Chief Economist Sam Khater said mortgage rates declined this week amid a steep sell-off in U.S. stocks

articles.description: Single and small multi-family homes must include solar panels starting in 2020. Recent extreme weather events such as wildfires and drought make the need clear, a state official says.

articles.title: GM Lordstown plant: Ohio's U. S. Senators Rob Portman, Sherrod Brown meet with GM chief Mary Barra over factory closing - Cincinnati.com
articles.content: Sherrod Brown is a Democrat, Rob Portman a Republican. Both want to save an Ohio auto plant. Cincinnati Enquirer Sen. Sherrod Brown, D-Ohio, left, and Sen. Rob Portman, R-Ohio, speak to reporters after a meeting with General Motors CEO Mary Barra to discuss G… [+3229 chars]
articles.author: Padmanada Rama and Julie Carr Smyth
articles.description: GM announced last week it will stop making the Chevy Cruze at its Lordstown, Ohio, plant by March and is considering closing the plant for good.
